body: @ErikEJ Do you know what scenarios this breaks?
Well- the behaviour change exposed a bug in my stored procedure mapping code. Could imagine it would effect some reverse engineering scenarios.

issue.title: Context class name changed using EF Core 7

repository.name: EFCorePowerTools
repository.description: Entity Framework Core Power Tools - reverse engineering, migrations and model visualization in Visual Studio & CLI

issue.body:
Describe what is not working as expected.
I am investigating moving a project to Core 7 from Core 6.  When I reverse-engineered the database using "EF Core 7" the context name changes -
the context name is defined as "CDPS_SOMBContext" in the dialog.  the generated context class is renamed to "CDPSSOMBContext"

If I re-generate using "EF Core 6", the context name reverts to "CDPS_SOMBContext"

Is that the expected behavior for "EF Core 7"?

### Provide technical details

- EF Core version 7

- Is Handlebars used: no

- Is T4 used: no

- Is .dacpac used: no

- EF Core Power Tools version: 2.5.1201.0

- Database engine: (SQL Server 216)

- Visual Studio version: ( Visual Studio 2022 17.4.0)

body: Looks like the first issue is in now: https://github.com/ErikEJ/EFCorePowerTools/issues/1577

issue.title: Invalid configuration when scaffolding a manytomany table with underscore in fieldname

repository.name: efcore
repository.description: EF Core is a modern object-database mapper for .NET. It supports LINQ queries, change tracking, updates, and schema migrations.

issue.body:
Assume the following database

```sql
CREATE TABLE Blogs (Id int IDENTITY CONSTRAINT [PK_Blogs] PRIMARY KEY) 
go 

CREATE TABLE Posts (Id int IDENTITY CONSTRAINT [PK_Posts] PRIMARY KEY) 
go 

CREATE TABLE BlogPost (
  Blog_Id int NOT NULL CONSTRAINT [FK_BlogPost_Blogs] REFERENCES Blogs ON DELETE CASCADE,
  Post_Id int NOT NULL CONSTRAINT [FK_BlogPost_Posts] REFERENCES Posts ON DELETE CASCADE,
  CONSTRAINT [PK_BlogPost] PRIMARY KEY (Blog_Id, Post_Id)
)
go 
```
(Note the field names are Blog_Id and Post_Id, also the name of the ManyToMany table is singular to avoid #29544)

When scaffolding in EF7 the following Configuration will be created.
```cs
 modelBuilder.Entity<Blog>(entity =>
 {
     entity.HasMany(d => d.Posts).WithMany(p => p.Blogs)
         .UsingEntity<Dictionary<string, object>>(
             "BlogPost",
             r => r.HasOne<Post>().WithMany()
                 .HasForeignKey("PostId")
                 .HasConstraintName("FK_BlogPost_Posts"),
             l => l.HasOne<Blog>().WithMany()
                 .HasForeignKey("BlogId")
                 .HasConstraintName("FK_BlogPost_Blogs"),
             j =>
             {
                 j.HasKey("BlogId", "PostId");
                 j.ToTable("BlogPost");
             });
 });
```
When executing the following statement:
```cs
  var allposts = await ctx.Blogs.SelectMany(b => b.Posts).ToArrayAsync()
```
The following SQL will be generated:

```sql
SELECT [t].[Id]
FROM [Blogs] AS [b]
INNER JOIN (
    SELECT [p].[Id], [b0].[BlogId] 
    FROM [BlogPost] AS [b0]
    INNER JOIN [Posts] AS [p] ON [b0].[PostId] = [p].[Id] -- PostId is invalid name should be Post_Id
) AS [t] ON [b].[Id] = [t].[BlogId]
```
Which results in an exception:
``Microsoft.Data.SqlClient.SqlException: 'Invalid column name 'PostId'.``

EF Core version: 7.0
Database provider: (e.g. Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.SqlServer)
Target framework: (e.g. .NET 7.0)
Operating system:
IDE: (e.g. Visual Studio 2022 17.4)

body: @bricelam Looks like we should probably patch this.

repository.name: efcore
repository.description: EF Core is a modern object-database mapper for .NET. It supports LINQ queries, change tracking, updates, and schema migrations.

issue.title: [release/7.0] Allow underscores in identifiers again

repository.name: efcore
repository.description: EF Core is a modern object-database mapper for .NET. It supports LINQ queries, change tracking, updates, and schema migrations.

issue.body:
Port of #29821
Fixes #29450

**Description**

A change in the validation of identifier names resulted in an unintentional breaking change.

**Customer impact**

If the generated files would contain underscores the customer needs to add them manually to allow them to compile against existing code.

**How found**

Customer reported on 7.0

**Regression**

Yes.

**Testing**

Adjusted the tests for the affected scenario

**Risk**

Low; the fix reverts the affected code to the 6.0 version.
